page.title: 15HENLLAN COMMUNITY COUNCIL
page.content: In April 1985 Henllan was granted its own Community Council after 600 years inside the borough of Denbigh. For the previous ten years Henllan had a Neighbourhood Committee which borr_ owed the constitution of a London authority. This unofficial 'watchdog' was established because local people thought that Henllan was being neglec_ ted by Denbigh. The ten members of the Community Council meet once a month.Their brief: 1) to discuss planning applications; 2) to improve the environment e.g.care of footpaths,bus shelters, and the removal of abandoned vehicles; 3) to inform other Councils of the needs of the village. Henllan's one policeman gives the C.C. advice about traffic problems. He also serves Llannefydd and Groes.He helped to police the miners'strike in '84-85.
